text:
Sport When can Celtic win the Scottish Premiership? All you need to know as Hoops close in on title Brendan Rodgers' men are currently 27 points clear at the summit of the table and it's only a matter of time before the trophy is mathematically sealed Share Celtic are closing in on a sixth consecutive Premiership title (Photo: Getty) Share Get football updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The way things are going, Celtic will win the league with a massive NINE games to spare. 
Brendan Rodgers’ side has been dominant in the league this season. 
Celtic are a whopping 27 points clear of second and third placed sides Aberdeen and Rangers and have won an average of just over 2.9 points per game. 
Aberdeen, who have a game in hand, have the next best record in the league with an average of just under 1.9 points per game. Read More The Hoops have dominated the Scottish top flight this term (Photo: Ian MacNicol) Brendan Rodgers has enjoyed a magnificent debut campaign in charge of Celtic (Photo: Ian MacNicol) 
Should those two sides maintain that form up to gameweek 29, which occurs on the weekend of March 18 and 19, then Celtic will be on 87 points to Aberdeen’s 56 with only 24 points left to play for. 
That means that Aberdeen wouldn’t be able to catch Celtic no matter what happens. poll loading Will Celtic win the Scottish title by 40 or more points? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
